column4: I would like the Pictures, Music and Video folders to be shared between users so that I do not have to have copies of all my media on both users...... how is this possible?
you can either set the appropriate permissions or move the folders out of the home folder
but can both users use the same folder equally?
Either method are more or less the same

I have Elisa Media Center working in another User without XGL loading so that Elisa can take full advantage of the 3D acceleration..... but I need Elisa to be able to grab the media from those three folders without me having to copy the data to that user and use up twice the disk space
hmm... ok, well, I think the easiest way is to move the folder to some folder in root, say /mediacenter
and give everyone read and write permissions
but Elisa looks by default at the Home folder where those three folder are.....
you can then add a symbolic link to your home folders
maybe AikoAIko's idea is better
oh I see... and delete the other 3 folders
what idea?
<AikoAiko> zetherroo: how about chmod a+rw the common directory and then ln -s common /home/dest
I dunno how to do any of that terminal stuff.... sorry

does it look at all the folders in home, or just specific folders?
those three
Let's say you have user1 that will hold all the media files
so for all other users... remove the Music, Video, etc folders
then do ln -s Video /home/user1/Video in each user's home directory
so just make shortcuts
finally in /home/user1/ chmod -R 777 Video
